timeline.bodyText:
shouldn't we adjust resource checking logic depending on an element being checked? for examples 'a' element is allowed to be without href attr whereas 'img' isn't
https://www.w3.org/TR/html52/semantics-embedded-content.html#the-img-element
https://www.w3.org/TR/html52/textlevel-semantics.html#the-a-element
timeline.author: uarlouski

replies.bodyText: I suppose it doesn't matter, the only one restriction is: an element must have src or href

replies.bodyText: I meant why should we fail during resource checking of links if it's not prohibited by spec to have a tag without href?
